instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message: Good day guys , have got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that initially was no power , however I found that it was missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> , I traced that to <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> found it faulty and then replaced it , afterwards, the board powers on , but would neither chime no display , so I tested with another EFI chip just to be sure , but same result , please where can I go from here , am considering replacing the 3 cpu phase mosfets , don?t know if that could result in a no display among it?s known failing issues

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message:
Do NOT solder refurbirshed "new" FDMF6808 from Cina sellers.
Buy new FDMF6708 from reliable store...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No display
threads.message: Thank you, the job has been discontinued
